page.title: 01AN OVERALL VIEW
page.content: This block surrounding Stoke Village is largely agricultural. It is over_ shadowed by Kingsnorth and Grain power stations and the storage tanks of a former oil refinery at Grain. Large employment in the construction industry has now ceased since the completion of the power stations and local employment now consists of maintenance duties only. Many are unemployed. Demolition of the refinery is almost complete. Agriculture gives temporary employment to women, cutting and packing cash crops. Quarrying for gravel between Hoppers Lane and Ratcliffe Highway provides a controversial bed for dumping waste. Pockets of housing development by a local builder has enhanced odd corners of the village. Travel to Chatham is expensive with bus fares at Â£2.40 return.
